props.name: variant
props.description: Change the visual style of the button.

props.name: leadingIcon
props.description: An icon to display before the button text.

props.name: trailingIcon
props.description: An icon to display after the button text.

props.name: id
props.description: A unique identifier for the item.

props.name: current
props.description: Indicates whether the item is the current item. No more than one item should be current at once. The path to the current item will be expanded by default.

props.name: defaultExpanded
props.description: The expanded state of the item when it is initially rendered. Use when you do not need to control the state.

props.name: expanded
props.description: The controlled expanded state of item. Must be used in conjunction with onExpandedChange.

props.name: containIntrinsicSize
props.description: The size of this item's contents. Passing this will set 'content-visiblity: auto' on the content container, delaying rendering until the item is in the viewport.

props.name: onExpandedChange
props.description: Event handler called when the expanded state of the item changes.

props.name: label
props.description: Provide an accessible label for the visual. This is not necessary for decorative visuals.

props.name: label
props.description: Provide an accessible label for the visual. This is not necessary for decorative visuals.

props.name: state
props.description: Specify a state if items in the subtree are loaded asynchronously. An asynchronous subtree can be in one of the following states: 'initial', 'loading', 'done', or 'error'. In the 'initial' state, items are neither loaded nor loading. In the 'loading' state, items are loading and the subtree will render a loading indicator. In the 'done' state, items are loaded. Screen readers will announce when a subtree enters the 'done' state. An 'error' state means that an error occured while loading items.

props.name: count
props.description: The number of items expected to be in the subtree. When in the loading state, the subtree will render a skeleton loading placeholder with the specified count of items

props.name: children
props.description: The content of the dialog. This is usually a message explaining the error.

props.name: title
props.description: The title of the dialog. This is usually a short description of the error.

props.name: onRetry
props.description: Event handler called when the user clicks the retry button.

props.name: onDismiss
props.description: Event handler called when the dialog is dismissed.
